p: Post-fermentation corn oil was characterized by the prevalence of tocopherols (981 ± 42.3 mg kg −1, corresponding to 72% of total tocols) over tocotrienols (379 ± 33 mg kg −1, corresponding to 28% of total tocols), with γ-tocopherol prevailing over α- and δ- homologues, as typical for corn [ 31, 35]. The levels of γ-tocopherol after saponification accounted for an average value of 742 mg kg −1, followed by α-tocopherol (216 mg kg −1) and very minor amounts of δ-tocopherol (22.4 mg kg −1).
